query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 La gloria di colui che tutto move 2 per l’universo penetra, e risplende 3 in una parte più e meno altrove.
query.result:
**English:**
1 The glory of Him who moves everything 2 penetrates the universe, and shines 3 more in one part and less in another.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Yasya śobhā jagad viśvam 2 Vyāpya tiṣṭhati bhāsate 3 Atrādhikamitastatra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Veramente quant’ io del regno santo 11 ne la mia mente potei far tesoro, 12 sarà ora materia del mio canto.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Truly, as much as I was able to treasure in my mind 11 of the holy realm, 12 will now be the subject of my song.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Satyam yāvat kiṃcid aham rājyasya pavitrasya 11 Manaḥi mama śaknuvāṃ cakartum nidhim, 12 Tad idānīm mama gītasya vastu bhavitā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 O buono Appollo, a l’ultimo lavoro 14 fammi del tuo valor sì fatto vaso, 15 come dimandi a dar l’amato alloro.
query.result:
**English:**
13 O good Apollo, for my final labor 14 make me a vessel worthy of your power, 15 as you are asked to give the beloved laurel.
**Sanskrit:**
13 He Apolla śubha, antaḥsaṃsthānaṃ me 14 tava śaktyā tathā kuru yathā 15 yācate tvāṃ priyaḥ allaraḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Infino a qui l’un giogo di Parnaso 17 assai mi fu; ma or con amendue 18 m’è uopo intrar ne l’aringo rimaso.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Up to this point, one peak of Parnassus 17 was enough for me; but now with both 18 I must enter the remaining arena.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Iha paryāptaḥ ekaḥ parvataḥ pārṇasasya 17 mama; atha idānīm ubhayābhyām 18 aveśanīyaḥ seṣaḥ āyataḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Entra nel petto mio, e spira tue 20 sì come quando Marsïa traesti 21 de la vagina de le membra sue.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 O divina virtù, se mi ti presti 23 tanto che l’ombra del beato regno 24 segnata nel mio capo io manifesti,
25 vedra’mi al piè del tuo diletto legno 26 venire, e coronarmi de le foglie 27 che la materia e tu mi farai degno.
query.result:
**English:**
22 O divine virtue, if you grant me 23 so much that the shadow of the blessed realm 24 you manifest, imprinted in my mind,
25 you will see me come to the foot of your beloved tree 26 and crown myself with the leaves 27 that matter and you will make me worthy of.
**Sanskrit:**
22 He devi śakti, yadi mama prayacchasi 23 tāvat yāvat bhagavataḥ rājyasya chāyā 24 mama śirasi likhitāṃ prakāśayasi,
25 mama tava priya-vṛkṣasya pāde āgacchantam 26 paśyasi, mama śirasi patra-mālāṃ dhastasi 27 yāṃ dravyaṃ ca tvam ca mama arhati kartaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Sì rade volte, padre, se ne coglie 29 per trïunfare o cesare o poeta, 30 colpa e vergogna de l’umane voglie,
31 che parturir letizia in su la lieta 32 delfica deïtà dovria la fronda 33 peneia, quando alcun di sé asseta.
query.result:
**English:**
28 So rarely, father, is it gathered 29 for triumph by either Caesar or poet, 30 the fault and shame of human desires,
31 that the Peneian laurel, when someone is crowned with it, 32 ought to produce joy on the joyful brow 33 of the Delphic deity.
**Sanskrit:**
28 Tathā viśeṣeṇa, pitaḥ, labhyate 29 jayāya vā ceśaraḥ vā kaviḥ vā, 30 manuṣya-kāmanāyā doṣaḥ ca lajjā ca,
31 yasmāt Peneīyaḥ pallavaḥ, yadā kena api svayam āropyate, 32 Delphī devatāyāḥ ānandamaye lalāṭe ānandam janayitum arhati, 33 yadā kaścid ātmānaṃ tena upaveśayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Poca favilla gran fiamma seconda: 35 forse di retro a me con miglior voci 36 si pregherà perché Cirra risponda.
query.result:
**English:**
34 A small spark can start a great flame: 35 perhaps behind me, with better voices, 36 someone will pray that Cirra will answer.
**Sanskrit:**
34 Alpāṃ viṣphuliṅgaṃ mahānnalaṃ dvitīyakaṃ janayati: 35 adhunā mama paścād uttamā vāṇīḥ santi, 36 yaḥ prārthayiṣyati yathā Cirrāḥ pratyuttaram dadāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Surge ai mortali per diverse foci 38 la lucerna del mondo; ma da quella 39 che quattro cerchi giugne con tre croci,
40 con miglior corso e con migliore stella 41 esce congiunta, e la mondana cera 42 più a suo modo tempera e suggella.
query.result:
**English:**
37 For mortals, the lamp of the world rises from different hearths; but from that 38 which joins four circles with three crosses, 39 with a better course and a better star 40 it comes forth conjoined, and the worldly wax 41 it tempers and seals more to its liking.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Martyeṣu viśvalokasya pradipo jāyate vividheṣu sthāneṣu; tatra tu tasmāt 38 yasmin catvāraḥ paridhiḥ saha tribhiḥ kṛṣṇabindukaiḥ sametāḥ santi, 39 śreṣṭhena gamanena saha śreṣṭhayā ca nakṣatreṇa saha 40 saḥ sambhūya nirgacchati, viśvasya mṛttikāṃ ca 41 svayam eva icchānusāreṇa vikṛtim āpadyate, lakṣayati ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Fatto avea di là mane e di qua sera 44 tal foce, e quasi tutto era là bianco 45 quello emisperio, e l’altra parte nera,
46 quando Beatrice in sul sinistro fianco 47 vidi rivolta e riguardar nel sole: 48 aguglia sì non li s’affisse unquanco.
query.result:
**English:**
43 It had made morning there and evening here, 44 at that pass, and nearly the whole of that hemisphere 45 was white, and the other part black,
46 when Beatrice, on my left side, 47 I saw turned and gazing at the sun: 48 never did an eagle fix its gaze so intently.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Tataḥ paraṃ tatra prātaḥ samabhavat, atra tu sāyam, 44 tasyāṃ diśi, tataś ca prāyaḥ sarvaṃ tadardhaṃ 45 śuklam āsīt, anyad ardham kṛṣṇam,
46 yadā vāmāṅge Beatriceṃ 47 pratyāvṛttām sūrye ca nirikṣamāṇāṃ apaśyam: 48 tathā kaścid api gṛdhraḥ pūrvam na cakṣuṣā niścitaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 E sì come secondo raggio suole 50 uscir del primo e risalire in suso, 51 pur come pelegrin che tornar vuole,
52 così de l’atto suo, per li occhi infuso 53 ne l’imagine mia, il mio si fece, 54 e fissi li occhi al sole oltre nostr’ uso.
query.result:
**English:**
49 And just as a second ray is wont 50 to issue from the first and rise upward, 51 just like a pilgrim who wants to return,
52 so from its act, infused through the eyes 53 into my image, mine was made, 54 and I fixed my eyes on the sun beyond our custom.
**Sanskrit:**
49 Evaṃ ca yathā dvitīyaḥ kiraṇaḥ 50 Ādyāt prabhavan punar āruhati, 51 Yathā vā pratyāvartana-kāmaḥ yatrikaḥ,
52 Tathā tasya karmaṇaḥ, cakṣuṣoḥ praveśāt 53 Mama pratibimbe, mama api abhavat, 54 Aham ca adityaṃ dṛṣṭavān asmākam maryādāṃ atītya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Molto è licito là, che qui non lece 56 a le nostre virtù, mercé del loco 57 fatto per proprio de l’umana spece.
query.result:
**English:**
55 Much is permitted there that is not permitted here 56 to our virtues, thanks to the place 57 made specifically for the human race.
**Sanskrit:**
55 Atrāsti bahu yat kiñcid atra na vidyate 56 asmākaṃ guṇānāṃ, sthānasyānugrahāt 57 kṛtasya viśeṣeṇa manuṣya-jātaye.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Beatrice tutta ne l’etterne rote 65 fissa con li occhi stava; e io in lei 66 le luci fissi, di là sù rimote.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Beatrice, completely absorbed in the eternal wheels, 65 gazed fixedly with her eyes; and I, in her, 66 fixed my gaze, from up there, afar.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Sarvāsu nityavartulīṣu nīmajjayantī 65 Nayanābhyām sthitā āsīt Beatrice; aham ca tasyām 66 Dṛṣṭīṃ nītvā, tataḥ parebhyaḥ dūre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Nel suo aspetto tal dentro mi fei, 68 qual si fé Glauco nel gustar de l’erba 69 che ’l fé consorto in mar de li altri dèi.
query.result:
**English:**
67 In my appearance I became such within, 68 as Glaucus became when he tasted the herb 69 that made him a sea-god among the other gods.
**Sanskrit:**
67 Tasya rūpeṇa antaḥ praviṣṭo ’ham abhūvam, 68 Yathā Glaucus abhavat auṣadhim āsādya, 69 Yena sa samudra-deveṣu devaḥ abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Trasumanar significar per verba 71 non si poria; però l’essemplo basti 72 a cui esperïenza grazia serba.
query.result:
**English:**
70 To signify transcendence through words 71 is impossible; but let the example suffice 72 for one to whom grace grants experience.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Atīndriyārthaṃ vāgbhiḥ pratipādayitum 71 na śakyate; ata eva dṛṣṭāntaḥ paryāptaḥ 72 yasya anugraheṇa anubhavaḥ prāpnoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 S’i’ era sol di me quel che creasti 74 novellamente, amor che ’l ciel governi, 75 tu ’l sai, che col tuo lume mi levasti.
query.result:
**English:**
73 If I was alone, that which you created 74 anew, love that governs the heavens, 75 you know, for with your light you lifted me up.
**Sanskrit:**
73 Yadi aham ekaḥ āsam, yat tvam asṛjathāḥ 74 navīnam eva, prema yat dyaum śāsti, 75 tvam jānāsi, yataḥ tava prakāśena māṃ udvāhitavān asi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Quando la rota che tu sempiterni 77 desiderato, a sé mi fece atteso 78 con l’armonia che temperi e discerni,
79 parvemi tanto allor del cielo acceso 80 de la fiamma del sol, che pioggia o fiume 81 lago non fece alcun tanto disteso.
query.result:
**English:**
76 When the wheel that you eternally 77 desire, brought me close to it 78 with the harmony that you moderate and discern,
79 then it seemed to me that heaven was so kindled 80 by the flame of the sun, that no rain or river 81 or lake ever made anything so vast.
**Sanskrit:**
76 Yadā cakram yattvam nityam 77 icchitaṃ, mama prati ākṛṣṭam cakāra 78 saṃvādena yena saṃyojayasi vivecayasica,
79 tadā me tāvat suryalokāt prakāśitaṃ adṛśyata 80 sūryasya jvālābhiḥ, yathā varṣaḥ nadiḥ 81 hradaḥ vā kadācit tāvad vistīrṇam na cakāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 La novità del suono e ’l grande lume 83 di lor cagion m’accesero un disio 84 mai non sentito di cotanto acume.
query.result:
**English:**
82 The novelty of the sound and the great light 83 of them aroused in me a desire 84 never felt before with such intensity.
**Sanskrit:**
82 Śabdasya nautanyam jyotir api ca mahat 83 Tayoḥ kāraṇāt mama kāmānām utpādaḥ 84 Na pūrvam evaivam-ākāraḥ kathañcana.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Ond’ ella, che vedea me sì com’ io, 86 a quïetarmi l’animo commosso, 87 pria ch’io a dimandar, la bocca aprio
88 e cominciò: «Tu stesso ti fai grosso 89 col falso imaginar, sì che non vedi 90 ciò che vedresti se l’avessi scosso.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Then she, who saw me as I was, 86 to calm my troubled soul, 87 before I asked, opened her mouth
88 and began: "You yourself make yourself gross 89 with false imagining, so that you do not see 90 what you would see if you had shaken it off.
**Sanskrit:**
85 Tatra sā mama bhāvam jñātvā, 86 mama cittam ākulīkṛtam śāntayitum, 87 mama praśnena pūrva eva, mukham vivṛte
88 ca vaktuṃ ārabdhā: "Tvaṃ eva ātmanam sthūlam karoṣi 89 mithyākalpanayā, yataḥ na paśyasi 90 yat paśyetha yadi tat parityaktasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Tu non se’ in terra, sì come tu credi; 92 ma folgore, fuggendo il proprio sito, 93 non corse come tu ch’ad esso riedi».
query.result:
**English:**
91 You are not on earth, as you believe; 92 but a thunderbolt, fleeing its proper place, 93 did not rush as you do, who are returning to it.
**Sanskrit:**
91 Tvam na asi pṛthivyām, yathā tvam manyase; 92 api tu vidyut, sva-sthānam parityajanti, 93 na dhāvati yathā tvam yaḥ tasya समीपे punar āgacchasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 S’io fui del primo dubbio disvestito 95 per le sorrise parolette brevi, 96 dentro ad un nuovo più fu’ inretito
97 e dissi: «Già contento requïevi 98 di grande ammirazion; ma ora ammiro 99 com’ io trascenda questi corpi levi».
query.result:
**English:**
94 If I was relieved of my first doubt 95 by the brief, smiling words, 96 I was ensnared even more by a new one
97 and I said: "I was already content and at rest 98 from great wonder; but now I marvel 99 at how I transcend these light bodies".
**Sanskrit:**
94 Yadi aham ādyasya saṃśayasya vimuktaḥ abhavam 95 hāsya-yukta-alpa-vacanaiḥ, 96 tataḥ apara-nava-saṃśayena atiśayena ābaddhaḥ abhavam
97 aham ca uvāca: "Pūrvam eva santuṣṭaḥ viśrāntaḥ abhavam 98 mahatāḥ adbhuta-bhāvasya; api tu adhunā adbhutam manye 99 katham aham etāni laghu-śarīrāṇi atītayāmi".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Ond’ ella, appresso d’un pïo sospiro, 101 li occhi drizzò ver’ me con quel sembiante 102 che madre fa sovra figlio deliro,
103 e cominciò: «Le cose tutte quante 104 hanno ordine tra loro, e questo è forma 105 che l’universo a Dio fa simigliante.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Then she, after a little sigh, 101 turned her eyes toward me with that look 102 that a mother gives her delirious son,
103 and began: "All things whatsoever 104 have order among themselves, and this is the form 105 that makes the universe resemble God.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Tataḥ sā, alpaśvāsam anantaram, 101 mama prati dṛṣṭim nyavedayat tena bhāvena 102 yena mātā unmāda-grastaṃ putram abhipaśyati,
103 ca uvāca: "Sarvāṇi bhūtāni 104 parasparam krameṇa sthitāni santi, ayam ca vidhiḥ 105 viśvam devamānīyate."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Qui veggion l’alte creature l’orma 107 de l’etterno valore, il qual è fine 108 al quale è fatta la toccata norma.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Here the high creatures see the trace 107 of the eternal value, which is the end 108 to which the created norm is made.
**Sanskrit:**
106 Iha eva uttamāḥ jīvāḥ paśyanti padacihnam 107 nityasya mahatmyasya, yat eva paryāptiḥ, 108 yasmin eva niyatāḥ sṛṣṭaḥ vidhiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Vero è che, come forma non s’accorda 128 molte fïate a l’intenzion de l’arte, 129 perch’ a risponder la materia è sorda,
130 così da questo corso si diparte 131 talor la creatura, c’ha podere 132 di piegar, così pinta, in altra parte;
133 e sì come veder si può cadere 134 foco di nube, sì l’impeto primo 135 l’atterra torto da falso piacere.
query.result:
**English:**
127 It is true that, just as form does not always accord 128 with the intention of the artist, 129 because matter is deaf to the call to respond,
130 so too the creature, who has the power 131 to bend, thus impelled, in another direction, 132 sometimes departs from this course;
133 and just as fire can be seen to fall 134 from a cloud, so the initial impetus 135 knocks it down, twisted by false pleasure.
**Sanskrit:**
127 Satyam eva, yathā rūpam na samvāditaṃ 128 anekaśaḥ kalāyāḥ saṅkalpāya, 129 yataḥ pratyuttarāya vastu muraḥ asti,
130 tathā ayam pravāhaḥ pratipadyate 131 kadācit sa jīvaḥ, yasya śaktiḥ asti 132 viviktaṃ nāmaiti, tathā pravṛttaḥ, anyatra;
133 ca yathā draṣṭum śakyate patanam 134 agneḥ meghāt, tathā vegaḥ prathamam 135 apaharati tam vikṛtam mithyāsukha-āt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Non dei più ammirar, se bene stimo, 137 lo tuo salir, se non come d’un rivo 138 se d’alto monte scende giuso ad imo.
query.result:
**English:**
136 You should not marvel more, if I judge correctly, 137 at your ascent, except as at a river 138 which descends from a high mountain to the bottom.
**Sanskrit:**
136 Na tvām āścaryam āviśatu, yadi mama matiḥ samyak, 137 tava ārohaṇe, vinā yathā nadyaḥ, 138 yāḥ parvatāt uttama-śikhara-deśāt adhastāt patanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Maraviglia sarebbe in te se, privo 140 d’impedimento, giù ti fossi assiso, 141 com’ a terra quïete in foco vivo».
query.result:
**English:**
139 It would be a marvel in you if, deprived 140 of impediment, you had sat down below, 141 as quiet on earth as fire in a living flame."
**Sanskrit:**
139 Acaryam bhavati yady apramāṇe 140 Nīce nīcīkṛtaḥ sthāḥ śānta iva, 141 Yathā jīvajvalane bhūtale vahniḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Quinci rivolse inver’ lo cielo il viso.
query.result:
**English:**
142 Then he turned his face toward heaven.
**Sanskrit:**
142 Tataḥ sa svakam vaktram nabhaḥ prati apavartayat.
